paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Data from the Mayo Clinic group indicate that the prevalence of this form among patients with amyloidosis is approximately 8.5%, with a mean age of 77 years and the male sex representing 82% of the affected individuals.

It has been found that it rarely occurs in patients below 70 years of age.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile mutation is more associated with the elderly and is predominantly male, presenting in 90% of the cases a clinical manifestation of a cardiomyopathy.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The Val122Ile mutation is a common variant associated with TTR amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The Val122Ile mutation is more associated with the elderly and is predominantly male, presenting in 90% of the cases a clinical manifestation of a cardiomyopathy.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The most prevalent mutation in the world population is Val30Met, which presents marked neurological involvement.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation is associated with familial amyloid polyneuropathy, presenting with neurological symptoms.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met mutation is the most prevalent mutation in the world population.
key_quotes: The most prevalent mutation in the world population is Val30Met, which presents marked neurological involvement.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
